Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Vocalization \Vo`cal*i*za"tion\, n. 1. The act of vocalizing, or the state of being vocalized. [1913 Webster]
2. The formation and utterance of vocal sounds. [1913 Webster]

vocalization n 1: the sound made by the vibration of vocal folds modified by the resonance of the vocal tract; "a singer takes good care of his voice"; "the giraffe cannot make any vocalizations" [syn: {voice}, {vocalisation}, {phonation}, {vox}] 2: the use of uttered sounds for auditory communication [syn: {utterance}]
